User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the TioraS platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was last updated.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product available for sale on the TioraS platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the product entity.

category.description: Category of the product (e.g., T-Shirt, Hoodie, Jacket, Accessories).

sizes.description: JSON string representing available sizes for the product (e.g., ["S", "M", "L", "XL", "XXL"]).

colors.description: JSON string representing available colors for the product (e.g., ["Black", "White", "Navy"]).

isNew.description: Indicates whether the product is a new arrival.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the product was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the product was last updated.

Design.title: Design
Design.description: Represents a user-generated or admin-created clothing design.

id.description: Unique identifier for the design entity.

product.description: Product type associated with the design (e.g., Hoodie).

imageUrl.description: URL of the generated image for the design.

status.description: Status of the design (Draft, Reviewing, Approved, Rejected).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the design was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the design was last updated.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents a customer order placed on the TioraS platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order entity.

status.description: Status of the order (Pending, Processing, Shipped, Delivered).

shippingAddr.description: JSON string representing the shipping address for the order.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the order was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the order was last updated.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an individual item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item entity.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product in the order item.

size.description: Size of the product in the order item.

color.description: Color of the product in the order item.

price.description: Snapshot price of the product at the time of purchase.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the TioraS e-commerce platform, focusing on AI-generated designs and product sales. It prioritizes authorization independence and efficient data retrieval.

**Authorization Independence:**

*   **Designs:** Designs are stored under `/users/{userId}/designs/{designId}`. The `Design` documents contain a `userId` field, which is denormalized authorization data. This enables security rules to validate ownership based on the path and the `userId` field within the document itself, without requiring `get()` calls to a parent `users` document.
*   **Orders:** Orders are stored under `/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`. The `Order` documents contain a `userId` field. This enables security rules to validate ownership without requiring `get()` calls.

**Structural Segregation:**

*   Designs are segregated based on user ID to ensure only the owner or admins can manage them. The Design review process would have a separate admin approval collection to ensure proper authorization rules.
*   Orders are segregated by User.

**Access Modeling:**

*   Private data (designs, orders) is modeled using path-based ownership under `/users/{userId}`.
*   Admin functions (e.g. approving designs) would require a `/roles_admin/{uid}` collection for DBAC.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   The structure uses path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/designs/{designId}`) which allows secure `list` operations for a specific user's designs. The security rules can efficiently filter by the `userId` embedded in the path, ensuring users can only access their own designs.

**Invariants:**

*   Timestamps (`createdAt`, `updatedAt`) can be enforced using security rules to prevent modification.
*   Ownership of designs and orders is maintained by the `userId` field and path-based structure.
